name: safe-rust
description: Safety-critical Rust development with 9-layer Swiss Cheese verification model. Features upfront design review, automated gate validation, and iterative refinement loops.

commands.name: safe-rust
commands.description: Start safety-critical Rust development with design review

commands.name: safe-rust:gate
commands.description: Run a specific gate validation (exit 0=pass, exit 1=fail)

commands.name: safe-rust:skip-layer
commands.description: Request to skip a layer with justification (requires proof of inapplicability)

commands.name: safe-rust:status
commands.description: Show current verification status across all layers

commands.name: safe-rust:loop
commands.description: Start iterative refinement loop until all gates pass

agents.name: orchestrator-architect
agents.description: Top-level orchestrator that conducts design review and coordinates all verification layers

agents.name: requirements-agent
agents.description: Layer 1: Formalize requirements with Rust-specific constraints

agents.name: tdd-agent
agents.description: Layer 3: Write comprehensive tests BEFORE implementation

agents.name: implementation-agent
agents.description: Layer 4: Implement safe Rust code to pass tests

agents.name: static-analysis-agent
agents.description: Layer 5: Run Clippy, cargo-audit, cargo-deny, unsafe audit

agents.name: formal-verification-agent
agents.description: Layer 6: Prove properties with Kani, Prusti, Creusot

agents.name: dynamic-analysis-agent
agents.description: Layer 7: Run Miri, fuzzing, coverage, timing analysis

agents.name: safety-agent
agents.description: Layer 9: Assemble safety case and make release decision
